Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for thursday, april 3rd. meta platforms is making headlines as the company announces a new push into the realm of virtual reality collaboration tools. ceo mark zuckerberg revealed plans aimed at integrating vr capabilities with existing workplace software to streamline remote team interactions. this initiative underscores meta's ongoing commitment to expanding its presence in the evolving metaverse landscape.

in other news, amazon is geared up to expand its drone delivery program with trials set to begin in select locations within california and texas. the initiative will focus on improving logistics efficiency and reducing delivery times while addressing regulatory and safety standards in the process.

meanwhile, google is facing antitrust scrutiny in europe as the european commission launched a formal investigation into its advertising practices. the inquiry seeks to determine whether google's dominance in the digital advertising market stifles competition. google has responded by stating its commitment to engaging constructively with regulators while emphasizing its intent to maintain fair practices.

lastly, samsung electronics saw a dip in shares today following a report that the company is planning to cut production at its semiconductor plants. this decision comes amid ongoing challenges in the global chip supply chain and a slowdown in consumer electronics demand. as one of the biggest players in the industry, samsung's move is likely to create ripples throughout the sector.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
"i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for thursday, april 3rd. meta platforms is in the spotlight as the company reveals its latest initiative to enhance virtual reality collaboration tools. ceo mark zuckerberg detailed plans to integrate vr capabilities with existing workplace software, aiming to streamline remote team interactions. this move highlights meta's ongoing commitment to carving out a significant presence in the ever-evolving metaverse landscape.

turning to retail giants, amazon is set to expand its drone delivery program, with trial runs launching in select locations across california and texas. this initiative aims to boost logistics efficiency and cut down delivery times, all while navigating regulatory and safety standards.

meanwhile, google finds itself under the european commission’s microscope with a new antitrust investigation into its advertising practices. the inquiry aims to assess whether google’s hold on the digital advertising market limits competition. google, in its defense, has expressed a willingness to cooperate with regulators, emphasizing its dedication to fair market practices.

lastly, shares of samsung electronics dipped today following reports that the company plans to reduce production at its semiconductor plants. the decision stems from ongoing global chip supply chain challenges and a slowdown in consumer electronics demand. as a major industry player, samsung's move is likely to send ripples throughout the sector.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow."
Podcast Title: EP-249 Meta's Vr Collaboration Push 🥽, Amazon's Drone Delivery Expansion 🚁, Google Faces Antitrust Scrutiny 🔍
Podcast Description:
```html

welcome to wall-e's tech briefing for thursday, april 3rd! explore today's featured tech stories:

  • meta's vr collaboration tools: ceo mark zuckerberg announces plans to integrate virtual reality capabilities with workplace software to enhance remote interactions and reinforce meta's metaverse presence.
  • amazon drone delivery expansion: trial runs of drone deliveries are set to launch in select locations across california and texas, aiming to improve logistics efficiency while adhering to safety and regulatory standards.
  • google under antitrust investigation: the european commission launches a probe into google's advertising practices to determine market competitiveness, with google expressing cooperation with the regulators.
  • samsung's production reduction: samsung electronics announces plans to cut semiconductor production amid global chip supply chain issues and decreased consumer electronics demand, impacting the industry landscape.

stay tuned for tomorrow's tech updates!

```
